page.title: 16Wide Game.
page.content: This game is played in Gloucester. 20_30 adults and children gather at the foot of Robinswood Hill. A quarter of the group has "tails" fixed to their backs and remain at the base. The others proceed to hide half way up the hill. When all are ready, the people with "tails" attempt to climb to the top of the hill without having their "tails" removed by the hidden members of the game. Those who achieve this, receive token prizes _ usually chocolate. Sometimes instead of "tails" each player carries an "aircraft part". The object then is to smuggle the parts to the other side of the hill, and there, assemble the aircraft. This is a more difficult version of the game, since, in order to win, all the parts must be available, at the other side of the hill.
